1.content: Son, defraud not the poor of alms, and turn not away thy eyes from the poor.

2.content: Despise not the hungry soul: and provoke not the poor in his want.

3.content: Afflict not the heart of the needy, and defer not to gibe to him that is in distress.

4.content: Reject not the petition of the afflicted: and turn not away thy face from the needy.

5.content: Turn not away thy eyes from the poor for fear of anger: and leave not to them that ask of thee to curse thee behind thy back.

6.content: For the prayer of him that curseth thee in the bitterness of his soul, shall be heard, for he that made him will hear him.

7.content: Make thyself affable to the congregation of the poor, and humble thy soul to the ancient, and bow thy head to a great man.

8.content: Bow down thy ear cheerfully to the poor, and pay what thou owest, and answer him peaceable words with mildness.

9.content: Deliver him that suffereth wrong out of the hand of the proud: and be not fainthearted in thy soul.

10.content: In judging be merciful to the fatherless as a father, and as a husband to their mother.

11.content: And thou shalt be as the obedient son of the most High, and he will have mercy on thee more than a mother.

12.content: Wisdom inspireth life into her children, and protecteth them that seek after her, and will go before them in the way of justice.

13.content: And he that loveth her, loveth life: and they that watch for her, shall embrace her sweetness.

14.content: They that hold her fast, shall inherit life: and whithersoever she entereth, God will give a blessing.

15.content: They that serve her, shall be servants to the holy one: and God loveth them that love her.

16.content: He that hearkeneth to her, shall judge nations: and he that looketh upon her, shall remain secure.

17.content: If he trust to her, he shall inherit her, and his generation shall be in assurance.

18.content: For she walketh with him in temptation, and at the first she chooseth him.

19.content: She will bring upon him fear and dread and trial: and she will scourge him with the affliction of her discipline, till she try him by her laws, and trust his soul.

20.content: Then she will strengthen him, and make a straight way to him, and give him joy,

21.content: And will disclose her secrets to him, and will heap upon him treasures of knowledge and understanding of justice.

22.content: But if he go astray, she will forsake him, and deliver him into the hands of his enemy.

23.content: Son, observe the time, and fly from evil.

24.content: For thy soul be not ashamed to say the truth.

25.content: For there is a shame that bringeth sin, and there is a shame that bringeth glory and grace.

26.content: Accept no person against thy own person, nor against thy soul a lie.

27.content: Reverence not thy neighbour in his fall:

28.content: And refrain not to speak in the time of salvation. Hide not thy wisdom in her beauty.

29.content: For by the tongue wisdom is discerned: and understanding, and knowledge, and learning by the word of the wise, and steadfastness in the works of justice.

30.content: In nowise speak against the truth, but be ashamed of the lie of thy ignorance.

31.content: Be not ashamed to confess thy sins, but submit not thyself to every man for sin.

32.content: Resist not against the face of the mighty, and do not strive against the stream of the river.

33.content: Strive for justice for thy soul, and even unto death fight for justice, and God will overthrow thy enemies for thee.

34.content: Be not hasty in thy tongue: and slack and remiss in thy works.

35.content: Be not as a lion in thy house, terrifying them of thy household, and oppressing them that are under thee.

36.content: Let not thy hand be stretched out to receive, and shut when thou shouldst give.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
